div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 1623 Jerusalem (Mount Ophel), Judaea, (714) 1926 Burial: c. 50 B.C. (Westermark) Contents: 319 AE. From excavations John Hyrcanus II: 4 Unc. (probably John Hyrcanus II): 4 Alexander Jannaeus: 303 Unc. (illeg.): 8 Disposition: Jerusalem (Dept. of Ant.) Lambert, PEQ 1927, pp. 184-8 PEFA 1927, pp. 103-5 Kadman, INCJ, hoard 18 Nos. 1-4 with letter Î‘, given to John Hyrcanus I, by Lambert are now commonly ascribed to John Hyrca- nus II
